summary: This is an email chain from July 20, 2021, between a journalist (Dipesh Gadher) and a US Attorney's Office contact (Nick) regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The journalist seeks clarification on trial structure, sentencing, the status of the investigation, and whether Prince Andrew remains a person of interest.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email inquiry; facing child sex trafficking and perjury charges.

persons.name: Dipesh Gadher
persons.context: Author of the email, a reporter for The Sunday Times seeking updates on the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Nick
persons.context: Recipient of the email from Dipesh Gadher; appears to be a contact at the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) providing case information.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in the journalist's question regarding whether he remains a person of interest in the ongoing investigation into Epstein's network.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in reference to the ongoing investigation into his and Maxwell's network.

connections.description: Referenced together as part of the network under investigation.
The email inquires if Prince Andrew remains a person of interest in the investigation into Maxwell and Epstein's network, implying an alleged association.
Journalist seeking information from a prosecutor/contact at the US Attorney's Office.

events.title: Scheduled Start of Maxwell's Main Trial
events.description: The journalist asks if the main trial on child sex trafficking charges is still scheduled to start in November 2021.

events.title: Period Covered by Trafficking Charges
events.description: The first trial is to cover child sex trafficking charges alleged to have occurred between 1994 and 2004.

events.title: Perjury Charges
events.description: Maxwell faces a second, separate trial on perjury charges related to 2016.

keyFacts: As of July 2021, the Ghislaine Maxwell case involved plans for two separate trials: one for child sex trafficking (1994-2004) and a second for perjury (2016).
The main trafficking trial was still scheduled to begin in November 2021 at the time of the email.
The maximum sentence previously discussed for Maxwell was up to 80 years in prison.
The investigation into the network of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell was described as potentially still ongoing.
A key question from the journalist was whether Prince Andrew remained a 'person of interest' in that ongoing investigation and if US prosecutors had obtained a statement from him.
